titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Laura Streett, Louise Loeb and Jared Berenholz

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Laura Streett April 2008..

did.head: Collection Summary
did.physdesc: 9.4 cubic feet (1 filing cabinet, 7 boxes, 3 framed items)

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Letters, manuscripts, speeches, poems, and other items, primarily resulting from an official connection with Vassar College, written by Vassar students, faculty or staff, or by persons of historical and cultural significance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Letters with some manuscripts, speeches, poems, and other items, primarily resulting from an official connection with Vassar College, written by Vassar students, faculty or staff, or by persons of historical and cultural significance.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Many items in the Autograph Files were separated from other collections.

p.archref: The letters of many individuals were separated from the collection and added to the Mitchell Kennerley Papers, June 1984. These include letters from Randolph G. Adams, Arnold Bennet, John Carter, Arthur Davison Ficke, Frank Harris, Allan A. Jefferson, Peter McArthur, and Blanche Shoemaker Wagstaff.
The letters of Margaret Stanton Lawrence and Martha C. Wright were separated from the collection and added to the Elizabeth Cady Stanton Papers.
The letters of Eva March Tappan were separated from the collection and added to the Eva March Tappan Papers.
The letters of Marianne C. Moore and Mary W. Moore were separated from the collection and added to the Marianne Moore Papers, Dec 2022.
The letters of Amy Lowell were separated from the collection and added to the Amy Lowell Papers, Jan 2023.

Letters to Vassar College President Sarah Blanding from various individuals were separated from the collection and returned to the Vassar College Office of the President Records - Sarah Gibson Blanding Files, Feb 2025. Correspondents include: Marian Anderson, Elizabeth Bowen, Dorothy Canfield Fisher, J. Robert Oppenheimer, Eleanor Roosevelt, and Adlai E. Stevenson.
The letters of Edward Elsworth were separated from the collection and added to the Edward Elsworth Papers, Jan 2026.
The letters of Margaret Lewis Livingston (1783-1860) were separated from the collection and added to the Margaret Lewis Livingston Papers, Feb 2026.
The letters of Henrietta Gardner Macy (VC Spec 1886-1887) were separated from the collection and added to the Henrietta Macy Papers, Feb 2026.

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Updated by Gretchen Maslin and Jenna Effenberger, 2011-2012.
Updated by Emma Gronbeck, Feb 2023 - Feb 2026.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Completed and updated by Jared Berenholz, 2008.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: An artificial collection, collected over several decades by Vassar College Library staff. Some materials were separated from other collections and added to the Autograph Files.
Many letters were the gift of Ruth Fitch Mason (VC 1912).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Autograph Files, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

did.unittitle: Aberdeen and Temair, Ishbel Maria (Marjoribanks) Gordon, Marchioness of,

p.emph: — Includes material on Paris peace treaty and national politics.

did.unittitle: Beecher, Catherine E., to John H. Raymond,

did.physdesc: (1 postcard, 2 letters, 1 envelope with 3 assorted items including photograph)

p.emph: — Includes letters to Helen Kenyon, Maria Mitchell, "Nellie" Raymond, and Adelaide Underhill.
— Includes material on excessive practice of ovariotomy and dangers to women from syphilitic husbands.
— Includes 2 letters from Frances Swan about Lydia Booth.
— Includes material on work as screen writer in Hollywood (1931), being a father, World War I experiences, and other issues.
— Includes correspondence with Alma Lutz on equal rights amendment and Buck's writing and speaking work.
— Includes correspondence between Benson J. Lossing and Stephen Buckingham on women as trustees.
— Includes material on using women's rights pioneers as film material.
— Includes material on her speaking engagements and personal news.
— Includes material on John H. Raymond's activities on behalf of fugitive slaves in Rochester.

did.physdesc: (1 letter, photocopy -- SEE Salmon Historical Collection for original)

did.unittitle: Fitzherbert, Maria Anne (Mistress of King George IV),
Furnivall, F.J., to Henry Noble MacCracken,

p.emph: — Includes material on women's rights.
— Includes material on life and people at Vassar College.

did.physdesc: (7 letters, 1 signed poem, 1 card, 1 signed photograph)
(5 letters, 1 copy, 1 envelope with speech enclosed)

did.unittitle: Howe, Julia Ward - Signed print of "Battle Hymn of the Republic,"

did.physdesc: (6 letters, one handwritten copy of a letter, 1 postcard)

p.emph: — Includes correpondence to Katherine Loring on having a case of the shingles, living arrangements in England, family affairs, American presidential politics, fire in Salem, Mass., European politics, literary events, Sarah Jewett, and Boston news.

did.unittitle: Jospeh, Toni (VC 1983), to Shirley Maul (VC Librarian),
[unidentified person with the initials, C. L.],

p.emph: — Includes letters from Helen Maguire Muller.

did.physdesc: (1 letter, 1 page of comments on a lecture)
(45 letters, 4 envelopes, 3 copies, 1 funeral pamphlet, 1 cloth item)
(1 letter, 1 page excerpts from Congressional Record)
(1 letter, with accompanying letter from Israel Coe)

p.emph: — Includes a letter received from George Combe about reform activities in Scotland and European revolutions (1848) as well as material on writing requests, Rochester abolitionist activities, Frederick Douglass, work of Lucy Stone and Antoinette Brown, women workers and pay inequities, work among blacks.

— Includes material on her commencement address at Spelman College, her writing, experiences in Ghana (1961-1962), the antics of her dog, work at Yale, and fund raising to assist African law students.
— Includes letter to Eleanor Roosevelt urging her to support the equal rights amendment.

did.unittitle: Parsons, [Thomas William], "Poppies" illuminated manuscript (to Florence Cushing, VC 1874),

p.emph: — Includes material on prayer and preaching, spiritual and religious ideas, Church affairs in Boston, and Theodore Parker.

did.physdesc: (2 letters, 1 postcard, 1 galley proof sheet, 1 memo)

p.emph: — Includes material on on Vassar College and women's education.

did.physdesc: (110 letters, 7 telegrams, 1 postcard, 2 documents, 1 envelope, 1 photograph)
(1 signature, 2 illustrations, 2 copies of a letter)
(61 letters, 36 envelopes, 8 notes, 5 documents, 1 newspaper clipping)

p.emph: — Includes material on Vassar College History Dept., labor issues, and personal news.
— Includes material on anti-fascism, political and social life in New York City, country life in Vermont, and a strike by Vermont marble workers.

did.unittitle: Shaw, Charlotte Frances (wife of George Bernard Shaw),

p.emph: — Includes material on teaching music and social events at Vassar College.
— Includes material on incident involving a runaway slave's confrontation with his white mistress (owner).

did.unittitle: Taylor, Kate Huntington (Mrs. James Monroe Taylor),

p.emph: — Includes material on Bryn Mawr positions for Vassar graduates, the Association of Collegiate Alumnae, and committee positions.
— Includes material on religion, writing, non-violence as part of Christianity, Shakers and chastity, evils of patriotism, and his health. Also includes letters from E.H. Crosby.
— Includes material on Leo's work among the Russian peasants (in French).
— Includes material on Vassar College Library affairs, salaries, and some personal issues.
— Includes material on T.S. Eliot's poetry, Tom Boyd's death, Katherine Mansfield and Middleton Murray, publishing issues, and personal news, largely to Ruth Fitch (Mason).

did.physdesc: (33 letters, 36 envelopes, 22 Christmas greetings, 10 postcards, 1 pamphlet, 1 note, 1 telegram, 3 newspaper clippings, 1 book made by nephew)
(21 letters, 3 pages of notes, 1 article copy)

did.unittitle: Washington, George, to the Hebrew Congregation of Newport, RI,

p.emph: — Includes material on her daughter attending Vassar.

did.physdesc: (1 document, 6 reprints of notes, 1 pamphlet, 1 envelope, 2 letters, 1 autobiographic note)
(18 letters, 1 poem, 1 page prose, 3 envelopes, 1 page notes)

p.emph: — Includes material on Vassar College Observatory, woman's equality and men's dislike of independent women, and family and personal news.

did.physdesc: (5 letters, 1 manuscript ("The Robin"), 1 envelope, 1 letter copy, 1 signed poem with photograph)

p.emph: — Includes material on lecturing at Vassar, Spanish Theater, women's education, his work and research.

did.physdesc: (3 letters, 7 letter copies, 1 copy of The President's War Message)

p.emph: — Includes material on shoemaker apprenticeship and wages and living costs in Woburn, Mass.

did.physdesc: (2 letters, 2 envelopes, 1 newspaper clipping, 1 transcript of toast at Alumnae Luncheon)
